subject: Web3
title: USDC: The Regulated Alternative
description: One-minute skill: USDC: The Regulated Alternative.

hook.text: USDC, issued by Circle, positioned itself as the transparent, regulated alternative to Tether.

buildup.text: Circle publishes monthly attestations from a Big Four accounting firm. Its reserves are held in cash and US Treasuries.

discovery.text: USDC became the preferred stablecoin for institutions, DeFi protocols, and businesses seeking regulatory compliance.

twist.text: In 2023, USDC briefly lost its peg when Silicon Valley Bank collapsed with $3.3 billion of Circle's reserves inside.

climax.text: The SVB scare showed that even the safest stablecoin carries risk. No bank deposit is guaranteed to be instantly available.

punchline.text: The most transparent stablecoin. Still not immune to banking crises.

quiz.question: What happened to USDC during the SVB crisis?
options: It briefly lost its peg because Circle had $3.3 billion in the failed bank
